programme.title: Race to Mars
programme.desc: Can the crew override the main circuit and successfully burn rockets to dock with Gagarin which is awaiting them in Mars orbit? Will they take the risk? Is such action mutiny? Rick reminds his crew of President’s Kennedy’s words at the beginning of the Apollo missions: “We choose to go to the moon not because it is easy but because it is hard…It is a challenge that we are willing to accept and unwilling to postpone.” The vote is unanimous. They will continue. Terra Nova successfully docks with Gagarin (Mars Ascending/Descending Vehicle) and the team climbs into their space suits. As a tribute to his great-grand parents, Mikhail carries a skull cap. Lucia has a photo of her dog. Rick holds his father’s pilot’s wings. As a group saluting all the nations of the world, the crew steps onto Mars. Rick, Jackie and Hiromi take a Surface Exploration Vehicle (SEV) to inspect their Habitat. There’s a problem. Not all of the landing gear has deployed. ‘Hab’ protocol prevents use until it’s stable. While struggling with the mechanism, Hiromi is pinned down and his space suit is punctured. Mikhail and Lucia rush Hiromi into the ‘Hab’. Finally, the other team members deploy the leg. The crew watches the world celebrate their safe landing as they celebrate Christmas. A dust storm rages around them. With a fractured arm, Hiromi cannot work. His fellow crew members take on extra shifts. Dust is causing more problems than anticipated. The drill which has been erected to search for water is breaking down and wearing out faster than predicted. Another blow from Houston: the Chinese have discovered water. Samples are being tested. A huge dust storm with an electrostatic discharge fries the drill’s electronics. And the Chinese results come in: the sample is saltier than the Dead Sea. It is highly unlikely that this water could have supported life. United behind their commander, the crew makes a request of the world’s leaders – allow us to use the Chinese drill to complete our mission.

programme.title: Don't Forget Your Passport
programme.desc: The lush delta panhandle of Botswana is home to some amazing African wildlife and host Gord Sivell explores the National Parks in this unique eco-system. He tours an ancient rock cave dwelling with 1,000-year old engravings and goes tiger fishing on the Okavango River system with a team of bush experts.

programme.title: Let's All Go To The Sea
programme.desc: The pursuit of happiness is one of the fundamental principles of the American constitution. And if there’s one place that embodies that principle it’s California on the West Coast. Two centuries after the west was won, this promised land still manages to attract modern-day gold diggers, inventors, dreamers, artists and the dispossessed.

programme.title: WWII Documentary Films
programme.desc: The Incredible Escape of Jewish-American B-17 Pilot Bruce Sundlun from Nazi-Occupied Europe in World War II. During overseas active duty beginning in June 1943 Bruce Sundlun, a Jewish-American college student, served as a B-17 Flying Fortress pilot in the England-based 384th Bomb Group of the Eighth Air Force at Grafton-Underwood Air Base. Sundlun’s plane, the Damn Yankee, was shot down over Nazi-occupied Jabbeke, Belgium on 1 December 1943 after being damaged by flak and attacked by German fighter planes following the bombing of Solingen, Germany, on the “Yankee’s” 13th mission over Europe. Five of his crew were killed, four others captured by the Germans. Above and Beyond is Bruce Sundlun’s amazing escape from occupied Europe in World War II, filmed on location in Belgium and narrated by Sundlun’s own daughter, Kara, who travelled back to the village of Jabbeke in Belgium, to re-trace her father’s footsteps in World War II.

programme.title: Blue Realm
programme.desc:
Around the globe, thousands of decommissioned naval vessels rot in dockyards. What can you do with these toxic time bombs? One solution is to clean them well, blow them up and sink them! Providing shelter and breeding grounds, countless fish and invertebrates colonize steel hulls.
In the Cayman Islands, the USS Kittiwake met a watery grave and quickly transformed into a vibrant artificial reef. In the Florida Keys, dozens of purposely sunk ships are a beacon to marine life, and to scuba divers. It seems like a win-win-win situation - for the environment, for divers and for cash strapped governments. But supporters face tough opposition on many fronts. After years of struggle, Canada's newest artificial reef project - the HMCS Annapolis, is nearing completion. But will protesters get their way and scuttle the sinking?

programme.title: A Nation Soars
programme.desc: The past and the present dramatically come together during the 100th Anniversary celebrations of the Battle of Vimy Ridge in Vimy, France. This program presents the epic journey of a squadron of former and active RCAF pilots and their replica FWW biplanes as they travel from British Columbia to France to participate in Canada’s official commemoration event on April 9th, 2017. Experience a gracious and historic homage to the bravery and sacrifices of Canadian pilots and soldiers who fought and died at the site of one of Canada’s greatest First World War victories.

programme.title: Race to Mars
programme.desc: Public support on Earth of true international cooperation has been universal. Rick and Jackie set off to cannibalize the Chinese drill. While the Chinese water samples are too salty to support life, the international crew hope that, because it is drilling in a different location, its results will be more positive. Ascent for return to the Gagarin is only 10 days away and the crew is fatigued and concerned about time slipping by. Now almost totally recovered, Hiromi pressures Rick for an opportunity to take a shift outside. Against the flight surgeon’s advice, Hiromi suits up. While he, Rick, Jackie and Antoine circle the drill, they hit water. But the drill is unstable and spurting slush all over the astronauts it blows apart, striking and killing Hiromi. The remaining five crew members have little time to mourn their loss as they must prepare for ascent from Mars. The Terra Nova is now homeward bound but the craft is full of mould and dust. Although the crew scrubs the craft clean, the astronauts get sicker every day. All systems tests are normal. What can be affecting all of the crew and why are they not responding to treatment? Finally, the flight surgeon suggests that their only hope is to break the seal on one of the Mars samples and test for alien contamination. Rick refuses this request. It’s a moral quandary: do they accept possible death from this undiagnosed disease or face a possible lifetime of quarantine on Earth if they are contagious?

programme.title: The Lower Depths
programme.desc: In a Japanese slum, various residents play out their lives, dreaming of better things or settling for their lot. Among them is a man who pines for a young woman but is stymied by her deceptive family.

programme.title: Claudiu And The Fish
programme.desc: Claudiu, 28 year old, works at the fresh fish department of a big supermarket, pitying the live carps crammed into a small, overpacked aquarium. After seeing one of these fish coughing like a human being, Claudiu, seriously troubled by the episode, asks his boss if he can bring a bigger aquarium, where the carps can feel more comfortable. Following a humiliating refusal from the boss, Claudiu decides to take revenge by making a bomb threat call and causing the evacuation of the entire store. But his satisfaction doesn’t last for too long: Claudiu learns that his prank call just sentenced to death all the living fish and thus he’s forced to go back inside the empty store and rescue them.

programme.title: Il Bidone
programme.desc: Aging small-time con man Augusto, who swindles peasants, works with two younger men: Roberto, who wants to become the Italian Johnny Ray.

programme.title: Faust
programme.desc: The demon Mephisto wagers with God that he can corrupt a mortal man's soul.

programme.title: Little Lord Fauntleroy
programme.desc: An American boy turns out to be the long-lost heir of a British fortune. He is sent to live with the cold and unsentimental lord who oversees the trust.

programme.title: Traces in the Snow
programme.desc: Traces in the Snow is a feature length documentary on Siberia’s punk scene in the 1980?s. Directed by Russian author and film director Vladimir Kozlov, this first-of-its-kind documentary uses rare footage of Siberian punk legends including the punk poet a

programme.title: Broad Comedy
programme.desc: Full of hilarious scenarios, characters, dialogue, and consequences, this selection of shorts has it all. A range of international films are included but the humor remains universal.

programme.title: Family Drama
programme.desc: Dramatic stories with broader and sometimes more accessible themes for everyone, this collection of shorts includes everything from family comedy, and animation to heavier hitting, gritty storytelling.

programme.title: Emotional High
programme.desc: This collection of short films are intimate, powerful dramas that will leave a lasting emotional impact with their tender, strong, emotive, and sometimes tear-jerking themes

programme.title: German Corner
programme.desc: A range of stand-out short films in the German language showcasing original stories, deeply layered characters, and high-quality production values. Some highly relevant themes are explored in this selection.

programme.title: Period/Historical
programme.desc: A collection of short films set in different times throughout history, from the battlefields of WW2 to the streets of 1950s Mississippi, these are dramas and action stories that focus on the power of individual choice and the strength of humanity.

programme.title: Mothers with Problems
programme.desc: Mothers and the challenges they face are at the center of this dramatic selection. The perspectives shift in each film, with stories that explore mothers at the end of their tether, mothers who’ll do anything for their children, and mothers who struggle to understand their own offspring.

programme.title: Intimate Drama
programme.desc: A focus on character-driven stories that leave an emotional impact through quietly powerful storytelling, often with a deeper social or psychological message beneath the surface.

programme.title: Best of Sofy
programme.desc: A selection of the most compelling, highest quality, emotionally impactful, and award-winning shorts on Sofy TV, includes a range of all genres from all over the world.

programme.title: Action
programme.desc: An action-packed selection but not always of the high octane variety, here you will also find stories of adventure and conflict, suspense and drama, and some highly original narratives.
